div.p: This example shows how you can propagate a state from page to page with XForms. Here the state is a number. This number is displayed and you can either:

ul.li: or set its value to zero.

div.p: The state is stored in the instance. The instance is declared as follows in the XForms model. The HTML form is generated in the view. The initial value of the counter is set to zero in the XForms model (see the counter element where the instance is declared). The value of the counter is also displayed in the view with <xforms:output ref="counter"/>.

The value of the instance is changed in the model. To make the change, the model needs to know if the user pressed the "reset" or the "increment" button. This is done by looking at the content of the action element in the instance document. The value of this element is set to the id of the button that was pressed.
